bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Westport has approximately a dozen burial grounds, plus other private family plots. The oldest cemetery may be Burial Hill which began as the Couch Family Cemetery. The oldest cemeteries in Westport follow the pattern predominant in the 18th century. The graves faced due east so that everybody could rise out of their grave facing the rising sun. Not every cemetery in Westport has been a peaceful place, such as the King Street Cemetery. It was the site of the ambush laid by Benedict Arnold for the British red coats in the Revolutionary War.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Newspaper clippings and other materials comprise this collection. Many of the articles concern the preservation and care of the burial grounds. Many cemeteries are not represented in this collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The cemetery folders are arranged in alphabetical order.
